connector.description: Perform SQL queries using Spring JDBC.

camel.source.path.query.name: camel.source.path.query
camel.source.path.query.description: Sets the SQL query to perform. You can externalize the query by using file: or classpath: as prefix and specify the location of the file.

camel.source.endpoint.allowNamedParamete.name: camel.source.endpoint.allowNamedParameters
camel.source.endpoint.allowNamedParamete.description: Whether to allow using named parameters in the queries.

camel.source.endpoint.dataSource.name: camel.source.endpoint.dataSource
camel.source.endpoint.dataSource.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the databaset at endpoint level.

camel.source.endpoint.dataSourceRef.name: camel.source.endpoint.dataSourceRef
camel.source.endpoint.dataSourceRef.description: Sets the reference to a DataSource to lookup from the registry, to use for communicating with the database.

camel.source.endpoint.outputClass.name: camel.source.endpoint.outputClass
camel.source.endpoint.outputClass.description: Specify the full package and class name to use as conversion when outputType=SelectOne.

camel.source.endpoint.outputHeader.name: camel.source.endpoint.outputHeader
camel.source.endpoint.outputHeader.description: Store the query result in a header instead of the message body. By default, outputHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body, any existing content in the message body is discarded. If outputHeader is set, the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved.

camel.source.endpoint.outputType.name: camel.source.endpoint.outputType
camel.source.endpoint.outputType.description: Make the output of consumer or producer to SelectList as List of Map, or SelectOne as single Java object in the following way: a) If the query has only single column, then that JDBC Column object is returned. (such as SELECT COUNT( ) FROM PROJECT will return a Long object. b) If the query has more than one column, then it will return a Map of that result. c) If the outputClass is set, then it will convert the query result into an Java bean object by calling all the setters that match the column names. It will assume your class has a default constructor to create instance with. d) If the query resulted in more than one rows, it throws an non-unique result exception. StreamList streams the result of the query using an Iterator. This can be used with the Splitter EIP in streaming mode to process the ResultSet in streaming fashion. One of: [SelectOne] [SelectList] [StreamList]

camel.source.endpoint.separator.name: camel.source.endpoint.separator
camel.source.endpoint.separator.description: The separator to use when parameter values is taken from message body (if the body is a String type), to be inserted at # placeholders. Notice if you use named parameters, then a Map type is used instead. The default value is comma

camel.source.endpoint.breakBatchOnConsum.name: camel.source.endpoint.breakBatchOnConsumeFail
camel.source.endpoint.breakBatchOnConsum.description: Sets whether to break batch if onConsume failed.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.expectedUpdateCoun.name: camel.source.endpoint.expectedUpdateCount
camel.source.endpoint.expectedUpdateCoun.description: Sets an expected update count to validate when using onConsume.

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to poll

camel.source.endpoint.onConsume.name: camel.source.endpoint.onConsume
camel.source.endpoint.onConsume.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed, if the Exchange was processed successfully, for example to mark the row as processed. The query can have parameter.

camel.source.endpoint.onConsumeBatchComp.name: camel.source.endpoint.onConsumeBatchComplete
camel.source.endpoint.onConsumeBatchComp.description: After processing the entire batch, this query can be executed to bulk update rows etc. The query cannot have parameters.

camel.source.endpoint.onConsumeFailed.name: camel.source.endpoint.onConsumeFailed
camel.source.endpoint.onConsumeFailed.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed, if the Exchange failed, for example to mark the row as failed. The query can have parameter.

camel.source.endpoint.routeEmptyResultSe.name: camel.source.endpoint.routeEmptyResultSet
camel.source.endpoint.routeEmptyResultSe.description: Sets whether empty resultset should be allowed to be sent to the next hop. Defaults to false. So the empty resultset will be filtered out.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.transacted.name: camel.source.endpoint.transacted
camel.source.endpoint.transacted.description: Enables or disables transaction. If enabled then if processing an exchange failed then the consumer breaks out processing any further exchanges to cause a rollback eager.

camel.source.endpoint.useIterator.name: camel.source.endpoint.useIterator
camel.source.endpoint.useIterator.description: Sets how resultset should be delivered to route. Indicates delivery as either a list or individual object. defaults to true.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.processingStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.processingStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.processingStrategy.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlProcessingStrategy to execute queries when the consumer has processed the rows/batch.

camel.source.endpoint.alwaysPopulateStat.name: camel.source.endpoint.alwaysPopulateStatement
camel.source.endpoint.alwaysPopulateStat.description: If enabled then the populateStatement method from org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy is always invoked, also if there is no expected parameters to be prepared. When this is false then the populateStatement is only invoked if there is 1 or more expected parameters to be set; for example this avoids reading the message body/headers for SQL queries with no parameters.

camel.source.endpoint.parametersCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.parametersCount
camel.source.endpoint.parametersCount.description: If set greater than zero, then Camel will use this count value of parameters to replace instead of querying via JDBC metadata API. This is useful if the JDBC vendor could not return correct parameters count, then user may override instead.

camel.source.endpoint.placeholder.name: camel.source.endpoint.placeholder
camel.source.endpoint.placeholder.description: Specifies a character that will be replaced to in SQL query. Notice, that it is simple String.replaceAll() operation and no SQL parsing is involved (quoted strings will also change).

camel.source.endpoint.prepareStatementSt.name: camel.source.endpoint.prepareStatementStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.prepareStatementSt.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy to control preparation of the query and prepared statement.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.templateOptions.name: camel.source.endpoint.templateOptions
camel.source.endpoint.templateOptions.description: Configures the Spring JdbcTemplate with the key/values from the Map

camel.source.endpoint.usePlaceholder.name: camel.source.endpoint.usePlaceholder
camel.source.endpoint.usePlaceholder.description: Sets whether to use placeholder and replace all placeholder characters with sign in the SQL queries.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.component.sql.dataSource.name: camel.component.sql.dataSource
camel.component.sql.dataSource.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the database.

camel.component.sql.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.sql.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.sql.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.sql.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.sql.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.sql.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.sql.usePlaceholder.name: camel.component.sql.usePlaceholder
camel.component.sql.usePlaceholder.description: Sets whether to use placeholder and replace all placeholder characters with sign in the SQL queries. This option is default true
